intro: Daviesia quoquoversus, commonly known as the golden daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, contributing to the floral diversity of these ecosystems. The species is named for its distinctive appearance and its ability to thrive in harsh environments.
